metadata.title: CVE-2019-19074 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak in the ath9k_wmi_cmd() function indrivers/net/wireless/ath/ath9k/wmi.c in the Linux kernel through 5.3.11allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption), akaCID-728c1e2a05e4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-118-generic - 4.15.0-118.119
linux-image-4.15.0-118-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-118.119
linux-image-4.15.0-118-lowlatency - 4.15.0-118.119
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-118-generic - 4.15.0-118.119
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-118-lowlatency - 4.15.0-118.119
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1097-oem - 4.15.0-1097.107
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-118.119').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1097.107').
